results.title: The Great American cowboy
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Educational Media Company and Keith Merrill
results.brief_description: An “in-the-arena” look at a rodeo that gives viewers a spectacular perspective of the life of today’s cowboys and follows the year-long championships quest of two competitors.

results.title: The Great adventure
results.brief_description: A classic study of man and nature in Central Sweden. It is a simple story of the eternal symmetry of nature; a mother fox preys upon a hen coop to feed her hungry cubs - the farmer preys upon the fox - the farmer’s dog chases a cub. In a second sequence two young boys rescue an otter from a hunter, and care for it through the four seasons. A beautifully sensitive evocation of the interdependence of animals and man’s relationship to them. Cannes Film Festival Award Winner, 1954.

results.title: The Great achievement
results.brief_description: This film tells of the part played by the New Zealand party, under Sir Edmund Hillary, in crossing the Antarctic continent in 1957. After wintering at Scott base the party sets out on the difficult and often frustrating trek to the Pole. The meeting with the Americans is shows with the arrival of Fuch’s party at Scott base. The film concludes with the triumphal homecoming to Wellington.

results.title: The Grasslands
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 1. Ecology”.
Illustrates the ecological interrelationships of the grasslands biome, giving examples of typical food chains. Shows the location of the world’s grasslands, expains how they may have originated an describes their importance as food producing areas.

results.title: The Grasshopper: a typical insect
results.brief_description: One of the most common and widely known insects is the grasshopper. Its body structure is show as exemplifying the basic characteristics that identify insects and its life cycle is studied as typical of those insects who go through a process of incomplete metamorphosis. The need for controlling the grasshopper’s destructiveness is also shown.

results.title: The Grasshopper and the ant
results.creator_credit: Carl Koch, Primrose Productions and Lotte Reiniger
results.brief_description: An example of the silhouette films of Lotte Reineger, based on the poem of La Fontaine. All summer long Grasshopper plays his fiddle for other animals and insects to dance, but Mrs. Ant, busy collecting fuel and food, criticises him for his levity. When winter comes he is near death from cold and hunger when a squirrel and a mouse take him in and care for him. He recovers and all including Mrs. Ant join in dancing to his fiddle. Music by Freddie Phillips.

results.title: The Grass is singing
results.creator_credit: Mark Forstater, Chibote Ltd, Svenska filminstitutet and Michael Raeburn
results.brief_description: Set against the overwhelming African bush, Karen Black as Mary Turner plays a desperate woman searching for security and love. Unable to come to terms with herself or the land she lives in, Mary accepts a marriage proposal from farmer John Thaw, rather than remain single in a big city. But this is not the escape she hoped it to be. Based on the novel by Doris Lessing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Forstater, Chibote Ltd, Svenska filminstitutet and Michael Raeburn

results.title: The Grapevine
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Office Supervisor’s Problems”.
Two girls discuss of rumour that they have heard that their company is merging with another company which would mean moving to another city. On another occasion new office equipment is obtained and the rumour is spread that girls are being replaced by machines. The office manager when confronted with the stories says there is no truth in them. He has not been generous in answering questions and they were nervous about going to him. The question for discuss is how rumour can be prevented from being started.
